text:
Goodbyes and New Beginnings

A tense room, characters fidgeting nervously.  
Sonia feels overwhelmed by attention.  
Raskolnikov: "Dounia, good-bye. Give me your hand."  

Dounia: "I did give it to you. Have you forgotten?"  

Raskolnikov: "Never mind, give it to me again."  
Dounia smiles, feels warmth, then pulls away.  

---

Raskolnikov returns to Sonia, a spark in his eyes.  
Raskolnikov: "God give peace to the dead."  
Sonia: "Isn't that right?"  
Sonia: "You seem different today."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The characters experience a mix of embarrassment and emotional connection as they say their goodbyes, highlighting their complex relationships.
